definitions.definition: To enroll or enlist new members or potential employees on behalf of an employer, organization, sports team, the military, etc.
definitions.example: We need to recruit more admin staff to deal with the massive surge in popularity of our products

definitions.definition: To supply with new men, as an army; to fill up or make up by enlistment; also, to muster
definitions.example: the army was recruited for a campaign

definitions.definition: To replenish, renew, or reinvigorate by fresh supplies; to remedy a lack or deficiency in.
To recuperate; to gain health, flesh, spirits, or the like.
definitions.example: Go to the country to recruit.

definitions.definition: To prompt a protein, leucocyte. etc. to intervene in a given region of the body.
